title: ADCs are too Lifesteal-independent right now
body:
In my opinion, the Marksmen in the bot lane have currently too much of an access to sustain options that are not regular Lifesteal, which contributes to the issue of them feeling like doing too much damage. If ADCs were more relying on Lifesteal for their sustain (for instance, in their third item), this overly high damage could potentially be delayed/not feel as overbearing.

Non-Lifesteal ADC sustain options:

- First up is Fleet Footwork. Despite its recent nerfs, it is still the most common Keystone on ADCs, and it especially synergizes with the Rapid Firecannon builds.
- Second is all the sustain from the support position. There's the Relic Shield line, which amounts to a lot of sustain in the end, and gives that sustain option to a class of supports whose weakness normally is a lack of said sustain. 
- Third, and a lot of people don't have this on the front of their mind, is **Red Buff**. This buffs is usually reserved for the ADC from the midgame onwards. However, it features a really powerful sustain effect that allows ADCs to start every fight with full health, despite not dedicating resources into said sustain.

With these options, specifically itemizing Lifesteal is less necessary, freeing the ADCs up to sink 10k+ gold into offensive stats without having to worry about anything else.

I disagree with this. Far too often, I'll dive the back line in a teamfight and nearly kill the ADC before dying. They're at under 200 health, any stray ability would likely kill them. One would think that forces the enemy ADC out of the fight (or they have to take a risk to go back in), but instead they just have to wait 3 seconds for a shield cooldown to be available, then go in with the shield (in case they do get hit before they lifesteal) and they start attacking again and are full health within a few seconds.

I would like to see that if I dive the enemy back line and nearly kill the enemy ADC, any of my allies can recognize that and flash on them to kill them. Like when the fight has been lost and our support is the lone person running away from the enemy top + adc (fight was 4 for 3), the support can choose to turn on the ADC and finish them, so the enemy team can't get any objective off of the won fight (instead of the top tanking baron or a few towers while the ADC melts them, all the while healing back to full health). Likewise you lose a fight mid, the enemy team's 4 survivors keep pushing down mid. The ADC was almost dead and built no lifesteal, but is always full by the time you respawn. So even though they overstay and have no lifesteal, you again can't one shot the ADC because they somehow healed to full.

There's a LOT of unappreciated value in the sustain that ADCs are getting that they don't need to buy for, and this definitely contributes to the issues people have with ADCs overall power level right now.

Meanwhile melees get the same lifesteal values as ADCs, but 95% of them don't have crit so they actually get lower values.

So with the heal setup and a AD heavy build or a ruunan´s hurricane i dont basically need any more lifesteal for a long,long time on most marksmen.

Marksmen are actually hella fragile, glass cannons even and they have the damage to boot, and while some supports makes it hard to hit them they still explode extremely fast if actually hit.

Thats why so many are so into going fleet footwork+overheal, the movespeed buff makes avoiding damage worlds easier and the barrier generated from overheal helps one endure poke and just survive a lot better.
